data.title: Obituary for Lottie "Dutchess" (Williams) Gaines
data.meta_description:
A Time to be Born

On April 30, 1959, in Donalsonville, Georgia the late Cora Lee Williams was gifted with the birth of Lottie Williams. At just a few days old...
data.text:
A Time to be Born

On April 30, 1959, in Donalsonville, Georgia the late Cora Lee Williams was gifted with the birth of Lottie Williams. At just a few days old she stole the hearts of the late Laroyal and Clara Williams as they raised her as their own in Bainbridge, Georgia.

A Time to Die

After laboring in the vineyard for most of her life, God called her home to rest on December 17, 2017. In Matthew 28:11, Jesus tells us, “Come unto me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden and I will give you rest.” Lottie Gaines gave up her life and found peace with her Heavenly Father.

Education

Lottie graduated from Bainbridge High School in 1977.

Work

She was employed with American Fibers for several years and later accepted a mental health position at the Florida State Hospital where she currently worked as a Unit Treatment and Rehabilitation Specialist.

Family

Lottie “Dutchess” Gaines leaves to cherish her memory; one daughter: Ashley Gaines of Bainbridge, Georgia; one god-daughter: Casey Howard of Bainbridge, Georgia; four god-grand kids: Travis, Chazden, Logan, and Aubri all of Bainbridge, Georgia; special family and friends: Alfred Fountain of Bainbridge, Georgia; Clara Clapp of Whitsett, NC; Linda Johnson of Augusta, Georgia; Chester Lee Holley, Jr. of Tallahassee, Florida; Annette Griffin of Cairo, Georgia; Jerome Moore of Bainbridge, Georgia; Johnny Hall of Bainbridge, Georgia; Clara Jones of Bainbridge, Georgia; Patricia Gaines of Bainbridge, Georgia; and Larry Gaines of Bainbridge, Georgia.
